sen.j: 山内 豊範（やまうち とよのり、弘化3年4月17日 (旧暦)（1846年5月12日） - 明治19年（1886年）7月13日）は、江戸時代末期の大名。
sen.e: Toyonori YAMAUCHI (May 12, 1846 – July 13, 1886) was a Daimyo (feudal lord) during the end of the Edo Period.
Toyonori YAMAUCHI (May 12, 1846 – July 13, 1886) was a Daimyo (Japanese feudal lord) who lived during the end of the Edo Period.
Toyonori YAMAUCHI (May 12, 1846 – July 13, 1886) was a Daimyo (Japanese feudal lord) who lived during the end of the Edo Period.

sen.j: 土佐藩の第16代（最後の）藩主。
sen.e: He was the sixteenth (last) Hanshu (Domain lord) of the Tosa Domain.
He was the sixteenth (last) lord of the Tosa Domain.
He was the sixteenth (last) lord of the Tosa Domain.

sen.j: 侯爵。
sen.e: Marquess
Marquess

sen.j: 第12代藩主・山内豊資の十一男。
sen.e: He was the eleventh son of the twelfth Hanshu Toyoshige YAMAUCHI.
He was the eleventh son of the twelfth lord Toyoshige YAMAUCHI.
He was the eleventh son of the twelfth lord Toyoshige YAMAUCHI.

sen.j: 正室は毛利信順（毛利斉熙三男）の娘、継室は上杉斉憲の娘。
sen.e: His first wife was the daughter of Nobuyuki MORI (third son of Narihito MORI) and his concubine was the daughter of Narinori UESUGI.
His lawful wife was a daughter of Nobuyuki MORI (third son of Narihito MORI) and his second wife was a daughter of Narinori UESUGI.
His lawful wife was a daughter of Nobuyuki MORI (third son of Narihito MORI) and his second wife was a daughter of Narinori UESUGI.

sen.j: 子は山内豊景（長男）、山内豊静（三男）、山内豊中（四男）、娘（大関増輝正室）。
sen.e: His offspring include Toyokage YAMAUCHI (first son), Toyoshizu YAMAUCHI (third son), Toyonaka YAMAUCHI (fourth son) and a daughter (first wife of Masuteru OZEKI).
His offspring include Toyokage YAMAUCHI (first son), Toyoshizu YAMAUCHI (third son), Toyonaka YAMAUCHI (fourth son) and a daughter (lawful wife of Masuteru OZEKI).
His offspring include Toyokage YAMAUCHI (first son), Toyoshizu YAMAUCHI (third son), Toyonaka YAMAUCHI (fourth son) and a daughter (lawful wife of Masuteru OZEKI).

sen.j: 三条実美の従兄弟。
sen.e: He is the cousin of Sanetomi SANJYO.
He was a cousin of Sanetomi SANJYO.
He was a cousin of Sanetomi SANJYO.

sen.j: 幼名は熊五郎。
sen.e: His childhood name was Kumagoro.
His childhood name was Kumagoro.
His childhood name was Kumagoro.

sen.j: 鹿次郎。
sen.e: Shikajiro.
Shikajiro.
Shikajiro.

sen.j: 号は鵬洋。
sen.e: His Go was Hoyo.
His Go (pseudonym) was Hoyo.
His Go (pseudonym) was Hoyo.

sen.j: 弘化3年（1846年）4月17日生まれ。
sen.e: He was born on May 12, 1846.
He was born on May 12, 1846.
He was born on May 12, 1846.

sen.j: 嘉永元年（1848年）に兄の山内豊熈（第13代藩主）、山内豊惇（第14代藩主）が相次いで死去したため、弟に当たることから後継者と目されたが、わずか3歳の幼少だったため、家督は分家出身の山内豊信（容堂）が継承することとなった。
sen.e: His elder brother Toyoteru YAMAUCHI (thirteenth Hanshu), Toyoatsu YAMAUCHI (fourteenth Hanshu) died in 1848 and he was seen as the successor as a younger brother but since he was only 3 years old, Toyonobu(Yodo) YAMAUCHI, who was from a branch line, became the family head.

His elder brother Toyoteru YAMAUCHI (thirteenth lord), Toyoatsu YAMAUCHI (fourteenth lord) died in succession in 1848 and he was seen as the successor as a younger brother but since he was only 3 years old, Toyonobu (Yodo) YAMAUCHI, who was from a branch line, became the family head.

His elder brother Toyoteru YAMAUCHI (thirteenth lord), Toyoatsu YAMAUCHI (fourteenth lord) died in succession in 1848 and he was seen as the successor as a younger brother but since he was only 3 years old, Toyonobu (Yodo) YAMAUCHI, who was from a branch line, became the family head.

sen.j: 安政6年（1859年）2月26日、豊信が井伊直弼の安政の大獄で隠居処分となったため、家督を継承し藩主となった。
sen.e: Toyonobu was sent into early retirement as punishment during Naosuke II's Ansei no Taigoku (suppression of extremists by the Shogunate) on February 26, 1859 and Toyonori succeeded as family head and became the Hanshu.

Toyonobu was sent into early retirement as punishment during Naosuke II's Ansei no Taigoku (suppression of extremists by the Shogunate) on February 26, 1859 and Toyonori succeeded as family head and became the lord of domain.

Toyonobu was sent into early retirement as punishment during Naosuke II's Ansei no Taigoku (suppression of extremists by the Shogunate) on February 26, 1859 and Toyonori succeeded as family head and became the lord of domain.

sen.j: しかし文久2年（1862年）に豊信の隠居が解かれると、実権は豊信に握られることとなり、豊範の主体性は薄かった。
sen.e: However, Toyonobu was allowed out of his retirement in 1862 and Toyonori did not take active part in ruling because the actual power was placed in Toyobnobu's hands.
However, Toyonobu was allowed out of his retirement in 1862 and Toyonori did not take active part in ruling because the actual power was placed in Toyobnobu's hands.
However, Toyonobu was allowed out of his retirement in 1862 and Toyonori did not take active part in ruling because the actual power was placed in Toyobnobu's hands.

sen.j: 同年、朝廷から京都警護の内勅を受ける。
sen.e: He received an imperial decree as a Kyoto Guard in 1862.
He received an secret imperial command for police escort in Kyoto in 1862.
He received an secret imperial command for police escort in Kyoto in 1862.

sen.j: 明治2年（1869年）には薩摩藩、長州藩などと共に連名で版籍奉還を行なった。
sen.e: Together with Satsuma and Chosu domains, he signed the return of lands and people to the emperor in 1869.
Together with Satsuma and Chosu domains, he signed the return of lands and people to the emperor in 1869.
Together with Satsuma and Chosu domains, he signed the return of lands and people to the emperor in 1869.

sen.j: また、義父上杉斉憲の米沢藩が戊辰戦争によって官軍の追討を受けるとその赦免に奔走した。
sen.e: He worked to get a pardon for his father-in-law, Narinori UESUGI of the Yonezawa Domain when he was being chased by the Imperial army.
He worked to get a pardon for his father-in-law, Narinori UESUGI of the Yonezawa Domain when he was being chased by the Imperial army, because of his commitment to the Boshin Civil War.
sen.cmt: 訳漏れbecause of his commitment to the Boshin Civil Warを追加
sen.e: He worked to get a pardon for his father-in-law, Narinori UESUGI of the Yonezawa Domain when he was being chased by the Imperial army, because of his commitment to the Boshin Civil War.

sen.j: 明治4年（1871年）の廃藩置県後は、鉄道事業や銀行事業などの成立に寄与している。
sen.e: After Haihan-chiken (abolition of feudal domains and establishment of prefectures), he contributed to the establishment of railway and bank projects.
After Haihan-chiken (abolition of feudal domains and establishment of prefectures), he contributed to the establishment of railway and bank projects.
After Haihan-chiken (abolition of feudal domains and establishment of prefectures), he contributed to the establishment of railway and bank projects.

sen.j: 明治19年（1886年）7月13日、41歳で死去した。
sen.e: He died on July 13, 1886, at 41 years of age.
He died on July 13, 1886, at 41 years of age.
He died on July 13, 1886, at 41 years of age.

sen.j: 墓所：高知県高知市天神町の真如寺。
sen.e: His grave is at Shinyo-ji Temple, Tenjin-cho, Kochi City, Kochi Prefecture.
His grave is at Shinyo-ji Temple, Tenjin-cho, Kochi City, Kochi Prefecture.
His grave is at Shinyo-ji Temple, Tenjin-cho, Kochi City, Kochi Prefecture.

sen.j: 後を長男・豊景が継いだ。
sen.e: He was succeeded by his first son, Toyokei?
He was succeeded by his first son, Toyokage.
He was succeeded by his first son, Toyokage.
